newsitem.title: FRANCE: PERNOD RICARD STOCK RISES ON H1 SALES.
newsitem.headline: PERNOD RICARD STOCK RISES ON H1 SALES.

text.p: Shares in French drinks company Pernod Ricard rose against the trend on Friday after the firm reported a higher than expected 10.4 percent rise in first-half sales.
Pernod Ricard's stock was up 1.83 percent at 312 francs at 1413 GMT while the CAC 40 index was 1.88 percent lower.

It has languished on the view that the company's business, notably such drinks as anise-flavoured pastis, is too dependent on the French market in comparison with the rest of the French drinks sector which includes big name exporters. But some brokers said Pernod's discount was large enough so that the stock was looking attractively priced.
Brokerage Ferri said in its daily comment that, while it remains fundamentally cautious on the stock, it considers it a short-term buy with an objective of 340 francs.

"The sales were good, and there was a clear improvement in sales growth in the second quarter, even stripping out currency changes and the acquisition of (Spanish gin company) Larios," Jean Weisse, an analyst at CPR Finance, told Reuters.
Pernod's sales, released late on Thursday, showed 15.9 percent growth in the second quarter after a 4.1 percent rise in the first.
